benchmark_details.name: Egyptian Wikipedia Scanner
benchmark_details.overview: The Egyptian Wikipedia Scanner is an online application developed to identify template-translated articles in the Egyptian Arabic Wikipedia using metadata and machine learning classifiers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To mitigate the problem of low-quality content produced by template-based translations in the Egyptian Arabic Wikipedia by providing a detection system for researchers and practitioners.

data.source: Articles from the Egyptian Arabic Wikipedia, filtered for quality and metadata-based classification.
data.annotation: Data labeled manually based on the analysis of articles' metadata.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using stratified K-Folds cross-validation on training and testing splits.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy rates indicate effective identification of template-translated articles.
methodology.baseline_results: Classifiers achieve performance accuracy ranging from 90% to 100%.

targeted_risks.harm: The model might misrepresent Egyptian culture by relying heavily on template-translated content.
